business.headline: Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high after early dip; Ola Electric shares up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 188.33 points to 83,267.99, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.90 points to 25,465.45
SpiceJet yet to pay Rs 350 crore in TDS, PF of employeesSpiceJet has not paid Rs 220 crore in TDS deductions from employees' salaries between April 2020 and August 2023 to tax authorities.

India's richest and poorest states: South leads GDP race, West Bengal stumblesWhile the southern states have emerged as major contributors to India's GDP, states like West Bengal, once economically strong, have witnessed a puzzling decline, according to a working paper released by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister.

NPS Vatsalya to be introduced today: Check scheme details, benefits and moreThe scheme, announced during the Budget in July 2024, is designed for parents and guardians to make long-term investments for their minor children.

Centre asks edible oil industry to maintain prices amid duty hike on importsThe leading edible oil associations were advised to ensure that the MRP of each type of oil is maintained until stocks imported at 0% and 12.5% BCD are exhausted.

Sensex, Nifty open flat ahead of US Fed's rate decision; Bajaj Finance jumps The S&P BSE Sensex was up 27.55 points to 83,107.21 at 10:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 0.90 points to trade at 25,419.65.

UK's Guardian in talks to sell Observer newspaper to Tortoise Media: ReportTortoise said negotiations include a commitment from it to invest more than 25 million pounds ($33 million) over the next five years in the editorial and commercial renewal of the title.

Smriti Irani discusses gender parity with World Bank leaders, highlights India's progressDuring her meeting in Washington, Smriti Irani highlighted the need for effective implementation of gender equity policies to ensure that women, especially in developing regions, can contribute to both government and industry while realising their full potential.

US Fed likely to cut key rates this week. Why is it a big deal?The US central bank is likely to cut interest rates for the first time in more than four years, with experts predicting a 0.25 percentage point reduction.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Supply chain attack turned pagers into killer devices in Lebanon?Lebanon pager blasts: What led to the pagers in Lebanon, which became obsolete in the early 2000s, to explode? Experts have called it a prime example of a supply chain attack.

Israel's Mossad planted explosives in Hezbollah's Taiwan-made pagers: ReportsIsrael's Mossad planted explosives inside 5,000 Taiwan-made pagers ordered by Hezbollah, months ahead of the mass detonations across Lebanon that killed nine people and injured nearly 3,000 on Tuesday.

Trump says India abuser of import tariffs, calls PM Modi fantastic ahead of meetFormer US President Donald Trump stated that he will be meeting with PM Modi next week during his three-day visit to the US.

A mother's powerful letter to EY India on 'work culture' after daughter's deathAnna Sebastian Perayil, a chartered accountant from Kerala, joined Ernst & Young in March as her mother blamed "four months of EY's callous attitude" for her death.

Kate Winslet got testosterone therapy to 'feel sexy'. What does it do to your body?Hollywood actor Kate Winslet has sparked curiosity among many women about the connection between testosterone and sex drive. Reports said Israel's Mossad spy agency planted explosives inside the Taiwan-made pagers.

Why Lok Sabha doesn't have many Shah Rukh KhansIf there's any profession that can match Bollywood in restricting smooth entry of outsiders, it is politics. Even as Iltija Mufti, daughter of former J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti, makes her electoral debut, here's a study that reveals how 32% of MPs in the current Lok Sabha are political dynasts. Shah Rukh Khans are rare.

Video: Multiple Ukrainian drone attacks force evacuation in Russian townThe video of the drone attack shows thick smoke billowing from the attack site. However, no information is currently available regarding the number of casualties.

Taiwan firm denies making pagers that detonated in LebanonMedia reports said Israel's Mossad spy agency planted explosives inside the Taiwan-made pagers. The explosions in Lebanon killed nine people and injured nearly 3,000 others.

Portion of building collapses in Delhi's Karol Bagh, 12 rescuedA senior police officer has confirmed that there were no reports of any casualties and the search and rescue operations are being carried out by the Delhi Fire Service, police and personnel from the National Disaster Response Force.

How bad is the high salt content in Delhi's groundwater for kidneys?One out of four groundwater samples in Delhi had a very high salt content. Doctors advise on how excessive salt could threaten the kidneys.

Image of Titan sub, chilling 3-word message before implosion revealedThe first photo of the Titan sub, which suffered a catastrophic implosion last year, killing five people onboard, was released during a public hearing. A chilling three-word text by the Titan's crew revealed that "all was good" even as the sub descended further.

WFI president urges Commonwealth Games to not drop wrestling in 2026The WFI president Sanjay Singh has urged the Commonwealth Games to not drop wrestling as a sport from the next edition of the competition. Scotland is set to host the next CWG after Australia backed out as hosts.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
